intro: Acanthopanax gracilistylus var. villosulus, commonly known as the hairy-stemmed Chinese angel's trumpet, is a climbing shrub native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its long, slender stems covered in fine, hairy pubescence. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both horticulture and traditional medicine.

It is commonly associated with rocky slopes and shaded understory environments within these mountain ranges. Due to its limited geographic range, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species in its native habitat.
